meanings.definition: Instructs by asking questions and receiving answers.
meanings.sent1: The teacher catechises the students to help them learn.
meanings.sent2: She catechises her children every evening to reinforce their knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The parrot catechises the curious kitten on how to catch a ball.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl catechises the young owlets on the ways of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The experienced coach catechises the new players on the rules of the game.

meanings.definition: Teaches the principles of Christian religion by questions and answers.
meanings.sent1: The catechises at the church are attended by many parishioners.
meanings.sent2: She studied the catechises diligently to prepare for her confirmation.
meanings.sent3: The colorful illustrations in the catechises book make learning fun.
meanings.sent4: The catechises session was like a journey through the history of faith.
meanings.sent5: The catechises class is a place of learning and spiritual growth.
